alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Knox; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 11:40PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Knox, Martin, Lawrence, southern Jackson and Daviess Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1140 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bedford to near Mount Carmel. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bedford around 1150 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for south central and southwestern Indiana.
